p: The chemical structures of the isolated compounds include 3β,7β-dihydroxyl-cucurbita-5,23,25-trien-19-al followed by Kaempferol-3- O- β-D-glucopyranoside have anti-microbial activity ( Odeleye et al., 2009). The fruits and leaves of M. foetida crop contain Momordicines and Foetidin (identical to Charantin). Phytochemical analysis of M. foetida revealed phenolic glycosides such as eriodictyol-, 5,7,4′-trihydroxyfl avanone-, kaempferol- and 5,7-dihydroxychromone-7- O- β-D-glucopyranoside ( Froelich et al., 2007). Other phytochemical analysis of M. foetida extract led to the presence of alkaloids, saponins and cardenolides ( Odusote and Awaraka, 2004).
